j.web

Class WebUtil

  • java.lang.Object

  • public final class WebUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    Web utilities.

    • Method Detail

      • htmlEncode

        public static java.lang.String htmlEncode(java.lang.String s)
        Gets the HTML encoded version of a string. Only the amperstand, angle brackets and double and single quote characters are encoded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if s is null

      • htmlEncode

        public static void htmlEncode(java.lang.String s,
              java.io.Writer w)
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the HTML encoded version of a string to a writer output stream. Only the amperstand, angle brackets and double quote characters are encoded.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if s or w is null
        java.io.IOException

      • parseAttrib

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parseAttrib(java.lang.String html)
        Parses an HTML fragment containing attribute pairs without the tag name, in to a map. This is a forgiving parser that does not adhere strictly to XML rules, but well-formed XML should be parsed correctly. This is not intended to be a substitution for a complete parser.
        Parameters:
        html - This must be in the format: attrib1="value" attrib2="value"
        Returns:
        Map of attrib-value pairs. The names and values are NOT HTML decoded.
